intro: Delphinium camptocarpum, commonly known as the zigzag larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
